abstract: Lawmakers across nation and abroad are struggling to determine how to regulate increasingly popular self-balancing motorized boards as laws have not caught up to technology; boards, also known as hoverboards, Swagways and personal transporters, are banned in many places, in many cases for liability reasons.
lead_paragraph: Self-balancing motorized boards, known as hoverboards, Swagways, self-balancing scooters or personal transporters, have forced lawmakers to figure out how safe they are and how to regulate them.

headline.main: Laws Struggle to Keep Up as Hoverboards’ Popularity Soars
headline.print_headline: Laws Struggle to Keep Up With Hoverboards’ Popularity

snippet: Self-balancing motorized boards, known as hoverboards, Swagways, self-balancing scooters or personal transporters, have forced lawmakers to figure out how safe they are and how to regulate them.
